reviews.sentence: Outdated. This hotel has not been updated in 25 years. The rooms are dark and ugly. Creepy Should be the Bates Motel.

Decent for the price. Rooms require some updating elevators were slow and breakfast buffet was not great. Would recommend a quality review to update property and services. Multiple internet disconnects and room phone call quality very poor.

I was expecting more. Bathroom needs updating. moldy shower grout door looked like it had been kicked in at some time. Pullout bed is useless as a bed better just sleeping on sofa. Asked for a cot. it never came but linens for it were delivered.

Good facilities small details could be improved. I am a luxury hotel employee and naturally bring additional scrutiny that many travelers would not so keep that in my when reading my review. I was traveling for work with a few of my associates staying in a room that my boss had booked for us through Expedia. There were some issues at check in with communication of the reservation from Expedia to the hotel but the Front Desk Supervisor Jesus handled the situation quite well. All of the rooms being suites is of huge convenience but they are a bit dated and the bathrooms are in desperate need of an update. The room was well cleaned but there were stains on the ceiling of the bathroom. Another reason this hotel gets a 3star review is because of the customer service. Little details make an entire experience and not calling me by name after checking my ID at check in or asking me how my stay was at check out left a bit to be desired. The breakfast was fine but they keep the bacon sausage behind the counter where they make the omelets so I feel as if I am inconveniencing the one chef who has to balance handing out these items while making omelets. Overall would recommend as an affordable hotel when visiting the surrounding area but this hotel should not be the purpose of your visit.

Good. The suite was quiet comfortable and easily accessible to the atrium. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and the bathroom fixtures and layout was very nice. The overall maintenance of the facility seems to be slipping. Carpets throughout are becoming threadbare broken signage often goes unrepaired and emergency phone near the exercise room is missing completely Is this a fire and safety code item. Also much of the exercise equipment is is need of routine maintenance and the weight machine is difficult to use and outdated. The bathroom door is in need of repair on it is backside where water from the tub shower has ruined the veneer. The worst problem was with the breakfast. The bacon and sausage being served was obviously old and stale on the verge of being dangerous. I alerted the waiter about it and observed that he did nothing as in speaking to the cook or floor manager. So I reached the conclusion that food service purposefully uses outdated food to get by on the cheap. Hotel literature and pictures on line show a bathroom scale as being in every room. There was none in our room. Consequently I was concerned that we may be charged for the missing scale but the front desk clerk said the scales had been removed and I would not be charged. So your literature should be updated to reflect this change. Exercise room ventilation seemed to be inadequate it was noticeable when more than three people were in the room at the same time.

pillow are old and not comfortable. Old tube TV. clean and friendly but otherwise in need of an update to rooms pillows etc. they are going cheap and will not spend a few extra bucks for some decent pillows and a flat screen tv. could use update to rooms in way of carpet bathromo tile etc. Bathroom fixtures are cheap. no iron or iron board in room staff is always nice. normally clean. pillows. TV.

The 80s called. Remember all the pink and brass that was around 1980s. Well this hotel still fully decorated like it is 1982. I expected to see David Haselhof or Burt Reynolds walking the hallway. The lighting in the room was horrible very dark CFL lightbulbs. TVs are the old fashioned tube type televisions that were around in the 80sThere are serious mechanical problems at this hotel. Some guests reported AC was horrible. Others noted water dripping through the ceiling. Elevators are terribly slow. Oh and by the way none of the bathrooms have an exhaust vent. So rather than embarrass themselves with a long bathroom visit several of our guests found themselves going to the public restroom in the lobby when they had some business to do. The front desk people especially the Indian looking woman I apologize I do not remember her name we are not helpful and even a bit rude even to my 80year old mother when she tried to check it. Rooms were not ready when promised. Guests arrived at 2 pm several had to wait hours for the room. The only thing that brought them up from zero stars to one star was their brunch she is pretty darn good. Restaurant staff are also very nice. I would take a pass on staying here unles the hotel goes through a major renovation. Spend your money on a better hotel. it is worth it.

Hotel was a great property but it seems investment in upkeep is lacking. Bathroom doors breaking toilet running faucet leaking tiles dirty. Ongoing maintenance is an issue. Weekend breakfast was great and the staff excellent.

Lobby under construction and updating of rooms. My previous stays were more positive. Once updating is completed then the hotel should be even better than past. Choices of restaurants are limited need car.

Pool was closed for repairs. Although that information is posted on their main website I went through Expedia and did not notice. Wish Expedia could find a way to alert others when repairs are being made to a hotel.
Getaway. The hotel was being remodeled during our stay. Other than that it was great very big and clean. I would love to come back to stay again once the remodeling is complete.
Weekend getaway. This hotel is clean except that it is being renovated. Price was reasonable. Room is small suite. Good value to your money.
Converting to Delta hotel. Hotel has always been a good value. Has now been renovated and is being converted to a Delta by Mariot. Updated and nice gym.
The recent room renovations are really nice. The rooms are very clean and the staff is very friendly.

Quite Nice. Although the reviews have been a bit mixed. I had a great evening at this hotel. The staff were engaging and friendly. The room was spacious well set up and in good repair. It is truly a suite configuration with a separate living area consisting of a sofa table credenza and television. Elite members have access to the pantry. This is essentially a self serve snack area. Arriving very late it had a few snack choices sorbets and beverages. In the morning there was a typical continental breakfast with boiled eggs pastries breads cereals etc. Pretty much what Mariot promises elites. You can take it back to your suite or down to the atrium tables. The gym is quite nice with a range of pulley machines dumb bells aerobic equipment and enough room to do a body weight workout. This gym is much better than typical. Overall I had a great stay and would return. The architecture is similar to a lot of the atrium style Embassy Suites locations. Probably nice when there is a blizzard outside. Uber from ORD is a bit high so best if you already have a car.

Renovated Renamed Hotel Makes Changes. Before our recent stay this place was a Wyndham Mariot and it catered to everybody. Now it is the Delta Hotel which seems to be mainly designed for the business person a short stay traveler who is only there to sleep and not spend much time there. There is nothing wrong with that at all because although we were there to visit family our room was comfortable and clean and nicely furnished. We always stay in a suite because our youngest son stays with us and that room option is still available. There is no breakfast included buffet in the central sitting area of the second floor like before and I miss that. However they do have a small restaurant bar area which offers limited meals and alcoholic beverages of course. They need to work on their and offer more choices. My son loved their French toast which was served with vanilla ice cream for breakfast a perfect meal to have on a “ vacation ” and a cheeseburger and fry option he ate at dinner and lunch twice. For myself I have to mention the biscuits and gravy. Please make it simple. Take all that pepper spice out of it. The gravy should look white or beige with chunks of sausage in it. The biscuits should be cut out of a floured dough and baked in a 400 degree oven. I ’m really not even sure how they made the biscuits. They Hotel still has a nice pool and workout room.

Nice comfortable newly renovated hotel. Newly updated hotel modern and sleek style. Love the suite set up with separate seating and sofa bed area refrigerator microwave sink. Great shower comfortable bed. Wish they had complimentary coffee in the lobby.

Well Done. Having recently undergone a top to bottom heavy remodeling this as new hotel offering was very comfortable almost hip in its vibe and an outstanding value. A welcoming staff was also a plus. Highly recommended.

Excellent option for a business or leisure trip. The hotel has been fully updated and renewed by Delta. Rooms are very spacious and contains all you need and all usually has a very good suite. Staff is very friendly and happy to help in any case. Everything for a quite reasonable price in Chicago suburbs.

Great service. We stayed here for our hockey tournament and our barista Montel was more than acomodating. His service was better than any. He cares about his customersRoms were updated and clean. Very family oriented. Good location. Thank you.
